comment: wish this class wouldve been in person (got switched to online). prof id deen is very nice but the actual workload of this course was a lot. multiple, long discussions every single week, field experience papers, etc. would've been better in person. she was nice i just think it was not done well for an online course. she is a tough grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: There are 2-3 discussions per week and big projects. Ensure you have 1-2 citations from the textbook or resources she lists to avoid losing points. The work can be a lot but it is not really difficult. She sets clear guidelines and examples. For extensions, email her in advance. She is so caring and sweet, I love her! (I took her in the summer)

I absolutely loved Dr. Id-Deen! She understands we all have lives and values your mental health, so there are times when you can get an extension or she can just be someone to talk to. I truly enjoyed being in her class.

I took this class over the summer online. If you take this class during the summer be prepared because you are going to do a lot of work over the summer and read a lot. I wish that she taught this class face-to-face during the summertime.

ECE 4465: LOVE HER, only class I genuinely enjoyed coming to. she is an easy grader & allows one extension for an assignment. there are 2 books you have to buy the textbook & Trouble makers but I wouldn't buy the textbook I only read it twice. this is a discussion based class and she will push you to get to know your peers, this class was a 10/10

TAKE HER!!! I honestly have never seen such an amazing professor! She cares so much. Her grading does take a minute but its because she truly cares about every single assignment. Her feedback is so specific and kind. She has super high expectations but she holds herself to them too. I highly recommend her for any class.

The best professor I have ever taken at KSU. I love her with everything in me. She makes all assignments super clear and walks through them with you to ensure you know what is going on. She truly cares about every student and wants you to succeed.
Dr. Id-Deen is such an amazing person and professor. I cannot recommend anyone better than her!

I absolutely loved this class and this professor. You learn so much about elementary math. This professor was so nice and loves when you participate in class discussions. She had very few assignments but they are time consuming so just be aware. Overall I would take this professor again.

She really cares about you. Participation matters, but she understands when you need a day or week off. You get 2 full-week extensions to use anytime. All assignments and lectures were purposeful. She WAS a tough grader. Also, I was stuck with a partner who did NOTHING and she didn't seem to care, we both got the same grade for the work I did alone

One of the best professors I have ever had at KSU. I took her both my freshman year and junior year, and would take her class again if I could. She is so caring, and makes sure to explain all information and assignments in depth. She does mental health check ins during the semester that really help with moral. If you can take her, do it!

She is so nice and caring. She always asks how we're doing and we focused on meaningful activities. A lot of group work and other projects. She likes to NOT take breaks during class so we can finish earlier. She's the kind to push through til the end Overall good professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: She is super sweet. She does have a lot of assignments so once you finish one get ready for another. I learned a lot from her and she is so caring. She makes an effort to get to know all her students & her powerpoint designs are SO CUTE!! Because of covid I had her online but I've had her before so I suggest taking her if you can!

Her personality is great which makes the lectures great. She has a lot of knowledge about the material and you will learn a lot of important information. She available if you need help and you are allowed one extension. There are about 6 assignments, no test or quizzes.
I LOVE her so much. She is passionate about learning and is so organized. She takes feedback and makes the course better. I would take her for all my classes if I could.

Caring and considerate- I definitely recommend. She is very knowledgeable and always willing to help you succeed. The assignments are graded straight off the rubric and she provides feedback on anything you did not meet. She is good with reminders and making sure everyone is okay. Attend class and participate, her lectures are valuable to teaching!

Dr. Id-Deen was an amazing professor. She was so caring and always emailed us back quickly. She was very detailed in her instructions for her assignments. Sad I didn't get to actually meet her in person due to the virus but if you get the chance to take her I would highly recommend it!

I really enjoyed Prof Id-deen like the other reviews, but her grading and feedback can be a little confusing especially near the end of the semester. I got comments about not having ___ in my paper, but the next sentence would say great ___! She waited a long time to get major projects back to us. Make sure you comb through each rubric.

Dr. Id-Deen is an amazing person and very knowledgeable in the content. She truly cared about everyone and really wants to help. Her assignments are very in depth and on the harder side, but still manageable. I recommend taking her as she is so inspirational, but be ready to work and be present in class.

She is hands down one of, if not the, best professor I ever had! Her classroom is full of positive vibes and she REALLY CARES about you! She is incredible, and inspiring. On top of that, she has great experience and I learned a lot about mathematics curriculum and culture in grades 4 and 5.

If you are on the fence let me convince you. She gets to know all of her students and checks in on your mental health. Her assignments are actually beneficial and not pointless. She is incredibly funny and will push back due dates if you submit an extension request. She understands our course load in block one and gave in-class work time. TAKE HER!

Professor Id-Deen was always available to answer any questions, and the grading criteria was always made very clear. There was a lot of reading and discussions due each week, but there are no tests, and a few essays.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Id-Deen is by far the best professor I have ever had. She is the perfect example of how all education majors should run a classroom. It is balanced so well. She opens the class with a personal check-in, so students can share positive or negative things (only if they are comfortable). Work load was completely manageable. I highly recommend her!
Dr. Id-Deen cares so much about her students and kids in general. She truly wants us to succeed and be great math teachers. My favorite class to go to!

Dr. Id-Deen is a wonderful professor with excellent pedagogy! You will leave her class with a better understanding of how to make mathematical learning more worthwhile and relevant for your future students. Also, she is incredibly sweet and cares about her students. Take her!
